id: Animals saved by firefighters, others killed in pet shop blaze north of Brisbane
paragraph:
Updated 
    
      November 18, 2018 15:18:27
    
Firefighters have come to the rescue of puppies, kittens, ducks and chickens but several other animals were killed after fire broke out in a pet shop north of Brisbane early on Sunday morning.Six fire crews were called to the blaze at the large pet store at Kallangur around 3:00am, and arrived to see flames coming through the roof at the rear of the building.Inspector Leigh Campbell from Queensland Fire and Emergency Services said the animals were evacuated from the burning building while firefighters worked to bring the fire under control. "Crews got into action and realised very quickly there were animals inside," Inspector Campbell said. "Our main priority was to rescue as many animals as possible — there were no persons, but of course any life is important, and the pets became the priority."Getting the animals out was difficult because a lot of them are in cages."There are some large dogs, there are small dogs, there's cats, there's ducks, there's all sorts of animals in there — it's a bit like rounding up sheep."Firefighters at the scene told the ABC six cats, a budgerigar, several lorikeets and a guinea pig were killed in the blaze.Several police officers at the scene gave some of the rescued animals a cuddle to calm them down.Police have declared a crime scene and investigators will work to determine the cause of the fire.Inspector Campbell said the flames were contained to the pet shop, but a neighbouring building sustained smoke damage.
